books.title: Wuthering Heights
books.author: Emily Bronte
books.description: Emily Bronte's classic novel tells the story of Heathcliff, a poor orphan boy who is brought to live at Wuthering Heights, the estate of his new guardian, Mr. Earnshaw. Heathcliff falls in love with Mr. Earnshaw's daughter, Catherine, but their love is doomed by class differences and societal expectations.

books.title: Kintu
books.author: Jennifer Nansubuga Makumbi
books.description: A sweeping tale of Uganda's troubled past, Kintu is a powerful and moving portrait of a nation in turmoil.

books.title: Stay with Me
books.author: Ayobami Adebayo
books.description: Set in Nigeria in the 1980s, Stay with Me is a poignant and heartrending story of love, loss, and the search for identity.

books.title: Behold the Dreamers
books.author: Imbolo Mbue
books.description: Behold the Dreamers is a powerful and timely novel about the immigrant experience in America, and the quest for the American Dream.

books.title: Things Fall Apart
books.author: Chinua Achebe
books.description: Widely regarded as a masterpiece of African literature, Things Fall Apart is a powerful and deeply moving story of a proud and fiercely independent tribe in Nigeria, and the devastating impact of colonialism on their way of life.

books.title: Becoming
books.author: Michelle Obama
books.description: In her memoir, Michelle Obama shares the story of her life, from her childhood on the South Side of Chicago to her years as First Lady of the United States. She reflects on the challenges she faced, the lessons she learned, and the people who inspired her along the way.

books.title: Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone
books.author: J.K. Rowling
books.description: The first book in J.K. Rowling's bestselling series follows the young wizard Harry Potter as he learns about his magical heritage and attends Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry. Along with his friends Ron and Hermione, Harry uncovers a dark secret that threatens the safety of the wizarding world.

books.title: The Catcher in the Rye
books.author: J.D. Salinger
books.description: This coming-of-age novel follows the story of Holden Caulfield, a teenage boy who has been expelled from his prep school. Struggling to come to terms with the adult world around him, Holden embarks on a journey of self-discovery that exposes the hypocrisy and phoniness of society.

books.title: To Kill a Mockingbird
books.author: Harper Lee
books.description: Set in the 1930s, this classic American novel tells the story of a young girl named Scout Finch and her father Atticus, a lawyer who defends a black man accused of rape. Through Scout's eyes, readers witness the injustices of racial prejudice and social inequality in the Deep South.

books.title: Animal Farm
books.author: George Orwell
books.description: This dystopian novel paints a bleak picture of a totalitarian society in which the government controls every aspect of citizens' lives. Set in a future where individuality and independent thought are forbidden, the novel follows the story of Winston Smith, a man who rebels against the oppressive regime.

books.title: Pride and Prejudice
books.author: Jane Austen
books.description: Pride and Prejudice is a novel by Jane Austen that follows the tumultuous romance between Elizabeth Bennet, the daughter of a country gentleman, and Fitzwilliam Darcy, a rich and proud aristocrat.

books.title: The Lord of the Rings
books.author: J.R.R. Tolkien
books.description: The Lord of the Rings is a high-fantasy novel by J.R.R. Tolkien that tells the story of hobbit Frodo Baggins and his companions as they attempt to destroy the One Ring, an artifact that grants its wearer immense power but also corrupts them.

books.title: Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone
books.author: J.K. Rowling
books.description: Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone is the first book in the Harry Potter series by J.K. Rowling. It follows young wizard Harry Potter as he discovers his magical heritage and begins his education at Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry.

books.author: George Orwell
books.description: 1984 is a dystopian novel by George Orwell that depicts a totalitarian society in which individuality is suppressed and dissent is punished. The story follows Winston Smith, a low-ranking member of the ruling Party, as he rebels against the oppressive regime.

books.title: The Picture of Dorian Gray
books.author: Oscar Wilde
books.description: The Picture of Dorian Gray is a Gothic novel by Oscar Wilde that tells the story of a young man named Dorian Gray who remains youthful and handsome while his portrait ages and reveals the ugliness of his soul.

books.title: The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy
books.author: Douglas Adams
books.description: The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy is a comedic science-fiction series by Douglas Adams that follows the misadventures of hapless human Arthur Dent and his alien friend Ford Prefect as they travel through space and time.

books.title: Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire
books.author: J.K. Rowling
books.description: Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone is the first book in the Harry Potter series by J.K. Rowling. It follows young wizard Harry Potter as he discovers his magical heritage and begins his education at Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry.

books.title: To Kill a Mockingbird
books.author: Harper Lee
books.description: Set in the deep South, Harper Lee's Pulitzer Prize-winning novel sees racial injustice envelop a small-town community. Through courage and compassion, lawyer Atticus Finch seeks the truth, and his daughter Scout—narrator of the tale—brings to life the people of Maycomb, Alabama, including the reclusive Boo Radley.

books.title: Vengance
books.author: Prince Ali
books.description: In the 25th century, the human mind has been digitized and can be downloaded into new bodies, called sleeves. Takeshi Kovacs, a former U.N. elite soldier, is re-sleeved into a new body to solve a murder. Along the way, he discovers a vast conspiracy that involves the powerful and wealthy.

books.title: To Kill a Mockingbird
books.author: Harper Lee
books.description: Set in the deep South, Harper Lee's Pulitzer Prize-winning novel sees racial injustice envelop a small-town community. Through courage and compassion, lawyer Atticus Finch seeks the truth, and his daughter Scout—narrator of the tale—brings to life the people of Maycomb, Alabama, including the reclusive Boo Radley.

books.title: Alfred Noble
books.author: Richard K. Morgan
books.description: In the 25th century, the human mind has been digitized and can be downloaded into new bodies, called sleeves. Takeshi Kovacs, a former U.N. elite soldier, is re-sleeved into a new body to solve a murder. Along the way, he discovers a vast conspiracy that involves the powerful and wealthy.

books.title: Jerusalem
books.author: Nicholas
books.description: Douglas Adams' comedic science fiction novel follows the misadventures of Arthur Dent, a hapless Englishman who is taken on a wild journey through space after the Earth is destroyed to make way for an intergalactic highway.

books.title: The Unbearable Lightness of Being
books.author: Milan Kundera
books.description: Milan Kundera's novel explores the themes of love, politics, and identity during the 1968 Prague Spring. The story follows Tomas, a surgeon, and his wife Tereza, as they navigate their relationship against the backdrop of political unrest and their own personal struggles.

books.title: Never Let Me Go
books.author: Kazuo Ishiguro
books.description: Kazuo Ishiguro's novel is set in an alternative universe where human clones are raised to become organ donors. The story follows the lives of three friends who grew up together at a secluded boarding school and are now facing the reality of their predetermined fate.

books.title: Where the Wild Things Are
books.author: Maurice Sendak
books.description: Maurice Sendak's beloved children's picture book follows the imaginative journey of a young boy named Max, who travels to a far-off land of wild creatures and becomes their king. The story explores themes of childhood imagination, adventure, and self-discovery.
